hint.text:
Irreducible factors cannot be broken down further.
Eg: \(x(2x+4y)\) can still be further reduced to \(2x(x+2y).\)

solution.text:
\(_{{2*m}}_x^2 = 2x^2 \times _{m}_, _{{2*n}}_x^3 = 2x^2 \times _{n}_x, _{{2*o}}_x^4 = 2x^2 \times _{o}_x^2 \), hence, 2 \(x^2\) is a common factor for all three terms.
Using distributive law,
\(_{{2*m}}_x^2 - _{{2*n}}_x^3 + _{{2*o}}_x^4 = 2x^2(_{m}_-_{n}_x + _{o}_)\)
